args:
The one plotting Phraeganoth's revival is
revealed to be Pele's own master, the former
king Archeole. The party defeats him, but their
victory is short-lived, for Phraeganoth begins
to tear his way into their realm, forcing the
prince to mount a final, desperate defense.
Whew! Nothing about that was easy.
Hmm? What's that on the ground?
You've seen one of those things before?
Only in books. They are powerful fragments\ndropped by equally powerful fiends.
The mana inside is said to be strong\nenough to bend the fabric of space itself.
Well, there goes my sound sleep.
Apologies. My thoughts drifted to the past.
Back to when the one-eyed fiend was still\nmy king.
Oh, so that one-eyed fiend is actually...\nWAIT, WHAAAAAT?!
Yes. He, too, was sealed in the space\nbetween worlds on the day we banished\nPhraeganoth.
The black mana permeating that place\ntransformed him into what you saw.
He must have gone mad if he wanted to\nunleash his former enemy on the world.
Even as a fiend, the king remained\nhimself.
Then why's he tryin' to free that super-evil\nguy he already locked away?!
But ever since his transformation, the king\nhas been uttering an unending stream of\nincantations.
These are aimed not at Phraeganoth,\nbut at some other unseen party.
You think that could be the wails from\nCelliera's story?
Regardless, I was his vassal. The failure to\nstop him in this mad pursuit is mine alone.
...Or perhaps I ought have aided him,\nif I were to be truly loyal.
Even if the world should fall.
I'm sorry. Please forget I said anything.
The tear in the space between worlds\nhas been rent completely asunder!
A sign of Phraeganoth's approach.\nThe volcano's mana writhes.
All this just because it draws near?!
We don't have a choice. We'll enter the rift\nfrom this side and stop him before he\ncrosses over.
Crossing between worlds is impossible\nwithout proper protection. The trip would\nflay the flesh from your very bones!
Then you would have us sit here and\nwatch our end come?!
I fear safe passage through that tear would\nrequire power beyond that which can be\nfound in this world.
I could not say with certainty.\nBut...it may be so.
Yet even if it were, Phraeganoth's power is\noverwhelming. Would you risk an unknown\ndanger only to face a more certain one?
We ain't about to turn and run when the\nfate of the world's on the line.
No matter how strong the opponent,\nwe will stand and fight.
If it costs our lives, at least they'll have\nbeen spent with purpose.
And who's to say we fight alone?
There may be other tears elsewhere in the\nworld—and other people brave enough to\nenter them.
Come on, everyone. Let's do this.
